body: Tentatively slated for 5.7 M1 solely for the purpose of _team discussion_

rename.from: Is it possible to de-register a TestExecutionListeners similar to deactivating conditions via pattern

body: **Team decision:** Let's add a `junit.platform.execution.listeners.deactivate` config parameter that can be set to a comma-separated list of fully-qualified class names of `TestExecutionListener` implementations that should be deactivated. The names may be supplied as patterns where `*` is supported as a wildcard. The deactivation only applies to listeners registered via `ServiceLoader`, but not to listeners passed to the `Launcher` explicitly. Similarly, we should change `junit.jupiter.conditions.deactivate` to support multiple, comma-separated patterns.
@nishantvas Would you be interested in submitting a PR for this?

@marcphilipp, sure. 
However, could you direct me towards what would be a starting point ?

I can see listeners being registered via `ServiceLoaderTestExecutionListenerRegistry` but that feeds to `LauncherFactory`

I can check further, but a pointer would help greatly.
`junit.jupiter.conditions.deactivate` I am aware of and can update it as per the decided approach.

I've submitted a pull request, I'm contributing to the project for the first time, so kindly let me know if there are more pre-requisites I need to cover

I'm unsure where I need to update the documentations as well unfortunately, so would need your support

issue.title: Add config parameter for deactivating auto-registered listeners

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
## Overview

- Add conditional property to be able to deactivate listeners being registered from ServiceLoader
- Update conditions deactivate to support csv configs

See #2181

---

I hereby agree to the terms of the [JUnit Contributor License Agreement](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/002a0052926ddee57cf90580fa49bc37e5a72427/CONTRIBUTING.md#junit-contributor-license-agreement).

- [x] Public API has [Javadoc](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#javadoc) and [`@API` annotations](https://apiguardian-team.github.io/apiguardian/docs/current/api/org/apiguardian/api/API.html)
- [x] Change is documented in the [User Guide](https://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/user-guide/) and [Release Notes](https://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/user-guide/#release-notes)
